file_content.text: Everything we built, just... crumbling away. And for what, credits?
Show those Hutts who's boss.
It takes courage to fly through danger. Trust your instincts, and we'll be fine.
I commend your bravery.
Never had a Jedi on my ship before. Wish I'd spruced up the inside a bit.
Didn't Makeb's first colonists run into this problem? The interference destroyed their communication equipment, they had to build the colony in isolation....
I know of this interference.
Right. Took decades to build a world worth having. Now the Hutts have stole it away.
Ion shielding, huh? Wouldn't mind some of that. Lots of hot landing zones around the galaxy.
Your shields sound handy.
Get rid of those Hutts, Major, and our Business Council will buy you a ship ten times nicer than mine.
Electromagnetic interference... that lightning will shake us like a rattle. You'd better know how to fly this thing.
I don't want to explode.
I've flown five hundred clean insertions, Captain, but you know what they say: There's always a last time.
How did the Cartel conquer your planet if most ships can't even get through the atmosphere?
But the Hutts landed an army.
Our politicians figured why draft an army when you can hire mercenaries? We bought the best--bunch of hard cases called the InterStellar Regulators.
But the Hutts didn't bother fighting them. They bought off the Regulators with a bigger bid. Ask Shalim Avesta, he'll tell you.
My shuttle's prepped. Hop aboard, and we'll be on our way. Might want to take your anti-nausea stims, too....
Don't show off your piloting skills. Just get us down there alive.
No fancy maneuvers, got it?
I'm doing cross-checks. Give me a few minutes, all right?
You're the Republic heroes who've come to free my homeworld? You're all so... wow.
You're one of the Republic heroes come to free my homeworld? You're just... wow.
I wish we'd joined the Republic ages ago.
When you stand with the Republic, it stands with you. We'll protect you from the Hutts, the Empire and anyone who threatens your freedom.
It's going to be alright.
That means a lot. The past two weeks have been a nightmare.
Your people could've joined us when the Sith Empire returned to the galaxy. What stopped you?
Why did you stay neutral?
That was before my time, but we've always minded our own business and not gotten involved in other peoples' fights. Stupid, huh?
You pledged yourselves to the Republic--but we have our own war to win after this. Makeb will do its part, and then some.
You'll owe us a lot for this.
We've got minerals, riches, hyperspace routes--whatever the Republic needs.
I was here when the Hutts blocked all of Makeb's comm channels. Haven't been able to get a signal from my family since. No idea what's happened down there.
The Hutts haven't been in control of your world for long. Most likely, your relatives are safe in their homes.
I'm sure your family is safe.
That's what I keep telling myself.
There's only one way to find out--fire up that shuttle's engines.
We'll know soon enough.
The Hutts don't treat conquered people well. If you're lucky, your family members are just slaves.
Prepare for the worst.
Then we'd better get going.
Don't know if they told you, but Makeb's atmosphere is a real mess. Most ships get torn to bits by electrical storms on entry.
My baby's got special ion shields to absorb the electromagnetic interference, but we're still in for a rough ride. Hopefully we won't land in little pieces.
